text: Bernard Stiegler (; 1 April 1952 - 6 August 2020) was a French philosopher. He was head of the Institut de recherche et d'innovation (IRI), which he founded in 2006 at the Centre Georges-Pompidou. His best known work was Technics and Time, 1: The Fault of Epimetheus and Echographies of Television. He was born in Seine-et-Oise, France. Stiegler died on 6 August 2020 in Paris at the age of 68.Le philosophe Bernard Stiegler est mort ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2020 deaths Category:French philosophers Category:Writers from Paris
